fields.description: I have no idea where to file this, but https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/source/browse/UWC lists https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/svn/UWC/trunk as the URL to check out the source.  That URL doesn't exist; it seems to be https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/svn/UWC/devel instead.
fields.summary: https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/source/browse/UWC lists wrong SVN url

fields.description:

This problem does not affect regular JIRA 4.0.1.
fields.summary: Stacktrace on Edit Profile screen if username contains a '@'

fields.summary: IDEA connector fails with permission errors when creating Crucible review

fields.description:
I tested this so far using the Eclipse connector with 2.0 of the Connector and so far, have tested adding a *Task Repository*.

During adding, it will not pass validation.  During the validation, the connector:
* Authenticates to JIRA via SOAP
* Then attempts to access /login.jsp and passes in the URL: {{os_username=xxxxx&os_password=xxxxxx&os_destination=%2Fsuccess}}

Since the login.jsp behaves differently on a GAPPs instance, this fails.
fields.summary: Atlassian IDE Connector doesn't work with Google Apps integrated Studio instances

fields.description:
Compare the Confluence Space Admin menu for a regular Confluence sysadmin (left) and a Studio administrator (right):

!conf_sysadmin.png! !conf_nonsysadmin.png! 


Some of these removals are intended, but I don't think the ones in 'Look and Feel' should be. Why should users not be able to define custom CSS for a space, or customize how the space's PDF export looks?

In any case, the PDF styling actions are still available to admins just by hacking the URL:

|| PDF Layout | http://$host.jira.com/wiki/spaces/flyingpdf/viewpdflayoutconfig.action?key=$key |
|| PDF Styling | http://$host.jira.com/wiki/spaces/flyingpdf/viewpdfstyleconfig.action?key=$key |

With $host and $key replaced.
fields.summary: Confluence space admin is missing links PDF layout and custom stylesheets
Streams is throwing a bad data exception on some data

fields.description: The user 'detkin' does not exist in the test data except in svn commits.
fields.summary: Replace all occurences of username 'detkin' to 'fred' in all functional test data and tests.

fields.description:
If a Subversion log, such as: {noformat} ------------------------------------------------------------------------ r111259 | nmenere | 2010-03-25 14:03:19 +1100 (Thu, 25 Mar 2010) | 1 line JRADEV-1211 - View Roles now part of details fragment {noformat} is pasted into a \{noformat} block in a JIRA issue comment, this causes two problems: - The rendered wiki markup in the issue transforms the revision link r111259 into {{tok2-inline-tok}}: !brokenrevparsing.png! - It breaks any activity streams that include this comment: !brokenactivitystream.png! In the logs one gets the error "The data ... is not legal for a JDOM character content: 0x1 is not a legal XML character.": {noformat} 2010-03-24 20:01:55,142 TP-Processor1 ERROR sysadmin 72115x4093x4 aw54im http://test.jira.com/plugins/servlet/streams [atlassian.streams.servlet.StreamsActivityServlet] Error getting activity org.jdom.IllegalDataException: The data "

Test:

^Atok2-inline-tok^B
" is not legal for a JDOM character content: 0x1 is not a legal XML character. at org.jdom.Text.setText(Text.java:188) at org.jdom.Text.(Text.java:99) at org.jdom.Element.setText(Element.java:630) at com.atlassian.streams.builder.DefaultSyndEntryBuilder.build(DefaultSyndEntryBuilder.java:90) at com.atlassian.streams.jira.JiraSyndEntryFactoryImpl.getSyndEntries(JiraSyndEntryFactoryImpl.java:136) at com.atlassian.streams.jira.JiraStreamsActivityProvider.getActivityFeed(JiraStreamsActivityProvider.java:114) at com.atlassian.streams.servlet.StreamsActivityServlet$1.doInTransaction(StreamsActivityServlet.java:118) at com.atlassian.sal.core.transaction.HostContextTransactionTemplate$1.doInTransaction(HostContextTransactionTemplate.java:25) at com.atlassian.jira.DefaultHostContextAccessor.doInTransaction(DefaultHostContextAccessor.java:34) at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor318.invoke(Unknown Source) .... {noformat} The minimum text necessary to trigger this error is: {noformat} \{noformat} r1 \{noformat} {noformat} Note there must be some text before the revision reference.
fields.summary: Pasting a Subversion log into JIRA breaks the activity stream

fields.description: The [Confluence Avatar Server|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/19488] allows FishEye/Crucible to use Confluence user avatars seamlessly. This would be perfect for Studio.
fields.summary: Consider installing Confluence Avatar Server

fields.description:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-17976

If a JIRA Studio user hits that bug, the wiki, svn and source portions of the Studio project will not be created at all.  This bug affects JIRA Studio much more than JIRA as it causes JIRA Studio to lose a huge chunk of functionality.

...
fields.summary: JRA-17976 causes JIRA Studio project creation to fail

fields.description:
Favorite is misspelled as favourite in many places in the UI.

As Krusty the Klown said so famously: "Hey, Yutz! Guns aren't toys.  They're for family protection, hunting dangerous or tasty animals, and keeping the King of England out of your face!"  For over 0.132*10^1 Centuries, that has included keeping their variant spellings out of our faces, as well.

;-)
fields.summary: Favorite is consistently misspelled in JIRA Studio 2.1

fields.description:
Add the following as a comment: {noformat} [something:{abc}] {noformat} This breaks the activity stream. The logs contain the following: {quote} 2010-03-23 17:08:30,228 TP-Processor8 ERROR mtaylor 61710x2105x1 1fiye64 http://test.jira.com/plugins/servlet/streams [atlassian.streams.servlet.StreamsActivityServlet] Error getting activity org.jdom.IllegalDataException: The data "

BOOM OUT GOES THE LIGHTS
something:tok0-block-tok

" is not legal for a JDOM character content: 0x1 is not a legal XML character. at org.jdom.Text.setText(Text.java:188) at org.jdom.Text.(Text.java:99) at org.jdom.Element.setText(Element.java:630) at com.atlassian.streams.builder.DefaultSyndEntryBuilder.build(DefaultSyndEntryBuilder.java:90) at com.atlassian.streams.jira.JiraSyndEntryFactoryImpl.getSyndEntries(JiraSyndEntryFactoryImpl.java:136) at com.atlassian.streams.jira.JiraStreamsActivityProvider.getActivityFeed(JiraStreamsActivityProvider.java:114) at com.atlassian.streams.servlet.StreamsActivityServlet$1.doInTransaction(StreamsActivityServlet.java:118) at com.atlassian.sal.core.transaction.HostContextTransactionTemplate$1.doInTransaction(HostContextTransactionTemplate.java:25) at com.atlassian.jira.DefaultHostContextAccessor.doInTransaction(DefaultHostContextAccessor.java:34) at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor318.invoke(Unknown Source) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:592) at com.atlassian.jira.ProxyAdapter$ProxiedComponentInvocationHandler.invoke(ProxyAdapter.java:167) at $Proxy292.doInTransaction(Unknown Source) ... {quote}
fields.summary: A particular sequence of characters within a comment on a JIRA issue breaks the Activity Stream

fields.description:
When adding users individually, users are marked active.

But when we bulk add 10+ users, the bulk adding code sets the users inactive in Crowd.

This prevents users from using Subversion.
fields.summary: Google user poller bulks add users and marks them inactive rendering them useless in SVN

fields.description:
We have been unable to run any builds since 2.1.1 upgrade on StAC.

The builds are triggered by changes and placed in the queue waiting for EC2 instance. When EC2 instance is started, the builds are still stuck in the queue, even though the log says it can be built on the EC2 remote agent.

After we stopped the builds, the builds are still said to be "in queue" even though the build queue is empty.

Restarting EC2 instance or Bamboo did not help.
fields.summary: Bamboo builds are "in queue" even though EC2 instance has been started and the queuing builds are stopped

fields.description:
The [Clover Coverage Gadget|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+the+Clover+Coverage+Gadget] is apparently part of the Bamboo plugin that is bundled by default with JIRA.  It Studio is simply doesn't work. The gadgets don't show up by default in the gadget directory.
 - According to the docs, it [requires|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Integrating+Bamboo+with+JIRA#IntegratingBamboowithJIRA-configureJIRAplugin] JIRA to be registered as an OAuth consumer in Bamboo, which isn't set up by default (and the link to manage oauth consumers is hidden).
 - The gadget URL {{http://$host.jira.com/builds/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.bamboo.gadgets/status/cloverCoverage.xml}} resolves and returns a valid-looking descriptor (both externally and on the Studio host), but trying to register it with the dashboard causes JIRA to return 400 error in response to the POST, stating {{Could not parse gadget spec at: http://$host.jira.com/builds/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.bamboo.gadgets/status/cloverCoverage.xml}}. I can register non-Studio Bamboo gadgets this way (although I haven't yet seen one fully working).
fields.summary: Bamboo gadgets (Clover Coverage, etc) broken in Studio

fields.description:
I noticed today that the sysadmin user on thestartupbus.jira.com was not in the confluence-administrators group. I talked to Alex & Dusan, and they thought that the sysadmin user is supposed to be in that group by default, and that on non-Gapps systems, this is generally the case.

The sysadmin does have the ability to place itself into this group, so this is probably not a critical issue, but is something to be aware of.
fields.summary: sysadmin should be in confluence-administrators group by default

fields.description:
the user browser displays users which are not in any groups as a collaborator, even though that user isnt one and doesnt count towards the license amount. It should display them as 'no access' instead.

|[!http://img.skitch.com/20100210-thhkrggpkj6hbyqns5w8rudw6f.png|width=600!|http://img.skitch.com/20100210-thhkrggpkj6hbyqns5w8rudw6f.png]|
fields.summary: the user browser should display disabled users as 'no access' instead of collaborators
NoClassDefFoundError com.cenqua.fisheye.cache.RecentChangesParams for /plugins/servlet/streams/local seems a streams conflict between studio's and fisheye's
Add 'Stars/Favourites' dropdown to both 'Source' and 'Reviews' tab
Spike to filter FE/CRU's get Stars ajax call so that we can decide what favourites are displayed under 'Source' tab and 'Reviews' tab
Do not allow to create review under the default Crucible project (probably when there is at least one Studio project)

fields.description:
Selecting Dashboard takes you to the same place that clicking on Reviews when no project selected takes you (or should we display the repo list?)
When a Studio project is selected, display the corresponding 'Crucible Project'.
Keep FishEye's Activity Stream same as it is now
People (Users) - no change to current FE functionality (we will address harmonizing user profile cross-suite in a future release)
User hover - specific to FE (we will address harmonizing user hover cross-suite in a future release)
fields.summary: Modify 'Reviews' tab's subnav menu to have the following items: Create new review, Dashboard, People, Search

fields.description:
* Selecting Dashboard takes you to the same place that clicking on Source when no project selected takes you (or should we display the repo list?)
* When a Studio project is selected, display the corresponding 'Repository'.
* Keep FishEye's Activity Stream same as it is now
* People (Users) - no change to current FE functionality (we will address harmonizing user profile cross-suite in a future release)
* User hover - specific to FE (we will address harmonizing user hover cross-suite in a future release)
fields.summary: Modify 'Source' tab's subnav menu to have the following items: Dashboard, Source, People
Quicknav dropdown in Bamboo renders ugly when the label is too long, and it does not allow user to select a result item.
quicknav dropdown misaligned with aui-shadow
Fisheye 2.2 does not redirect to JIRA login page

fields.description:
/wiki/admin/viewgadgetdirectory.action should be pre-loaded with all available gadgets from the Cloud suite.  This will reduce the number of tickets raised by customers requesting this sort of thing.

*Update:* Confluence now includes JIRA's gadget feed URL automatically, but JIRA still doesn't automatically include anything, nor does Confluence include any gadget feeds from the other apps.
fields.summary: Preload all Cloud gadgets (JIRA, Bamboo, Fisheye) into Confluence's External Gadget allow list and JIRA's gadget directory
Subversion arbitrary path permission management broken
Fix the style of quicknav dropdown in Fisheye 2.2 (see screenshot)
Fix the style of Fisheye 2.2 tool's menu dropdown (see the screenshots)
Make Fisheye's Studio footer's style in line with other apps
Hide the license hassle
Apply Default Review Time to new and existing Studio projects
Allow cusomter to base Crucible permission scheme on either the original "default" scheme or the new "agile" scheme for both new and existing studio projects
Replace FE/CRU favicon with Studio's favicon

fields.description:
We have several projects that have Wiki but no Issues.  When a user selects one of these projects using the top 'project select' navigation and the last context they were using was 'Issues' then the user is show a no permission  message on the Issues tab for the wiki-only project.

Project Selector should take user to the project home tab if user has no access to the tab/application last selected
fields.summary: Project Selector should take user to the project home tab if user has no access to the tab/application last selected
Make sure all files overridden by Studio are updated with the version from FE/CRU 2.2.1.1

fields.description: The licenses need to be added to the config.xml in the fisheye-home, instead of dropping the files in the fisheye-home directory.
fields.summary: Change the way FE/CRU license is updated in production

fields.description: Need to ask Michael Knighten after the changes.
fields.summary: Integration FE/CRU UI in Studio
Use FE/CRU's own sal-fisheye-plugin (broken) instead of SAL's sal-fisheye-plugin (built on FE/CRU 1.7.x)

fields.summary: Unable to create new Crucible project from Fisheye admin: NewProjectAction cannot be instantiated.
Crucible default permission scheme is deleted in functional test set up
Creating a new Crucible project CR-TST in FisheyeSetup with an exsiting repo breaks (TST is not in the options in the repo select)
Fix the studio dropdowns in all source/reviews pages

fields.description: Any Confluence plugins in Studio (that use Confluence's Velocity directly, rather than ATR) should opt into Anti-XSS protection: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Enabling+XSS+Protection+in+Plugins
fields.summary: Enable Confluence Anti-XSS mode in Studio plugins

fields.description: JIRA Studio projects with very large repositories cause Fisheye to time out when it tries to find the most recent commits.  The error message is, "Read timed out."  This shows up under Issues > Source and also Issues > Reviews.  Normally these sort of errors are resolved by increasing the API Connection Timeout and the API Socket Timeout.  Unfortunately, while AppLinks is enabled for Fisheye, these settings are not available.  You can work your way through the UI to attempt to change the settings but the changes aren't saved - Admin > Source > Source Config > Edit, Save.
fields.summary: Allow Fisheye Timeout modifications while AppLinks is enabled

fields.description:
Perhaps related to: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-5260

Restricted Admins should be able to delete build plans, right?

To reproduce on test.jira.com:

# Sign in with a non-system-administrator account
# Try and delete a plan

You'll get this error on the Web UI:
{code}
Error deleting build DPJ-TRUNK: Secure object: ReflectiveMethodInvocation: public abstract void com.atlassian.bamboo.build.BuildManager.deleteBuild(java.lang.String); target is of class [com.atlassian.bamboo.build.HibernateBuildManager] did not provide any argument of type: interface com.atlassian.bamboo.build.Build
{code}

And in the logs:

{code}
 2010-03-17 13:07:03,192 WARN [TP-Processor16] [AuthorizationLoggerListener] Authorization failed: org.acegisecurity.AccessDeniedException: Access is denied; authenticated principal: org.acegisecurity.adapters.PrincipalAcegiUserToken@f1b618e: Username: com.atlassian.bamboo.user.DefaultBambooUser@b844da55; Password: [PROTECTED]; Authenticated: true; Details: null; Granted Authorities: ROLE_USER, ROLE_RESTRICTEDADMIN; secure object: ReflectiveMethodInvocation: public abstract void com.atlassian.bamboo.build.BuildManager.saveBuild(com.atlassian.bamboo.build.Build); target is of class [com.atlassian.bamboo.build.HibernateBuildManager]; configuration attributes: [ACL_BUILD_EDIT]
 2010-03-17 13:07:03,192 ERROR [TP-Processor16] [DeleteBuilds] Error reseting deletion status for WEBSERVICE-TEST
 org.acegisecurity.AccessDeniedException: Access is denied
 	at org.acegisecurity.vote.AffirmativeBased.decide(AffirmativeBased.java:68)
 	at org.acegisecurity.intercept.AbstractSecurityInterceptor.beforeInvocation(AbstractSecurityInterceptor.java:292)
 	at org.acegisecurity.intercept.method.aopalliance.MethodSecurityInterceptor.invoke(MethodSecurityInterceptor.java:63)
 	at com.atlassian.bamboo.security.acegi.intercept.aopalliance.AuthorityOverrideMethodSecurityInterceptor.invoke(AuthorityOverrideMethodSecurityInterceptor.java:36)
 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
 	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
 	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
 	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
 	at $Proxy13.saveBuild(Unknown Source)
{code}
fields.summary: restricted admins can't delete Bamboo plans

fields.description:
Some customers running google apps will also have external clients/contacts/users that they will want to access JIRA Studio.  The ability to add non google users to JIRA Studio would provide much greater flexibility in how the platform is used.

This request also includes allowing access to users who are Google Apps users but from different domains.
fields.summary: Allow Google Apps users to add external users to Studio

fields.description: When trying to update status from FE/Cru, the app thinks you are not logged in.
fields.summary: Users cannot update status (except for sysadmin)

fields.description:
Create an issue in Studio by manual post, like:

{noformat}
curl "http://test.jira.com/secure/CreateIssueDetails.jspa?pid=10240&issuetype=1&summary=My+other%0D%0Atest+issue&description=Test%0D%0Adescription&os_username=...&os_password=..."
{noformat}

Note that the summary has a new line encoded as %0D%0A.

Once the issue is created, the user history breaks, because the JSON answer to the history request does not escape the new line. Firebug reports:

{noformat}
unterminated string literal
anonymous()com.atla...in:ajs.js (line 19)
anonymous()com.atla...in:ajs.js (line 19)
anonymous()com.atla...in:ajs.js (line 19)
anonymous()com.atla...in:ajs.js (line 19)
[Break on this error] :"DTP-23 An issue created via the JIRA S...m/browse/DTP-33",title:"DTP-33 My other\n
{noformat}

I consider this a bug in Jira, as it should escape the characters, but also in Studio, as the JSON should be escaped properly.
fields.summary: JSON response for issue history not escaped

fields.description:
When someone in the 'administrators' group goes to Administration -> Wiki and clicks the 'Administration' link, they get the error "You are not permitted to perform this operation.". The URL at this point is 'http://$host.jira.com/wiki/admin/createsupportzip.action#'.
!confadmin.png!


If they happen to know the trick about clicking the arrow to open the javascript menu, they see two options, 'Support Utility' which gives the above error, and 'OAuth' pointing to http://$host.jira.com/wiki/plugins/servlet/oauth/consumers/list, which when clicked goes into an infinite URL redirect.

None of this creates a particularly good impression. If functionality is not available to end users it should be removed from the menus.
fields.summary: Confluence 'Administration' menu options give permission error

fields.description:
It's possible that a notification can refer to a comment/reply that is deleted in Crucible.

When this happens, the Activity Stream fails to retrieve any further information from Crucible until new activity pushes down the Review that caused the problem:

{code}
WARN  - Reply 53doesn't exist
 ERROR - Error getting activity
 java.lang.NullPointerException
       at com.atlassian.streams.crucible.CrucibleSyndEntryFactoryImpl.getSyndEntryFromNotification(CrucibleSyndEntryFactoryImpl.java:70)
       at com.atlassian.streams.crucible.CrucibleStreamsActivityProviderImpl.addCrucibleActivity(CrucibleStreamsActivityProviderImpl.java:116)
       at com.atlassian.streams.fisheye.FishEyeStreamsActivityProvider.getActivityFeed(FishEyeStreamsActivityProvider.java:71)
       at com.atlassian.streams.servlet.StreamsActivityServlet$1.doInTransaction(StreamsActivityServlet.java:120)
       at com.atlassian.sal.core.transaction.HostContextTransactionTemplate$1.doInTransaction(HostContextTransactionTemplate.java:25)
       at com.atlassian.sal.spring.component.SpringHostContextAccessor$1.doInTransaction(SpringHostContextAccessor.java:88)
       at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:128)
       at com.atlassian.sal.spring.component.SpringHostContextAccessor.doInTransaction(SpringHostContextAccessor.java:82)
       at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor62.invoke(Unknown Source)
       at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
       at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
       at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.hostcomponents.impl.DefaultComponentRegistrar$1.invoke(DefaultComponentRegistrar.java:76)
       at $Proxy24.doInTransaction(Unknown Source)
{code}
fields.summary: Activity Stream not handling NullPointerException from Crucible Stream

fields.description:
Trying 10 times to register on studio.plugins.atlassian.com I cannot pass the captcha test.
Seems it is designed not for humans.
fields.summary: can not register at studio.plugins.atlassian.com

fields.description:
There is a bug where if you  click "post" while Crucible is ajax-autosaving your comment as a draft, it could get lost.

This problem is exacerbated by autosave kicking in exactly 2 seconds after you type your last character (about the moment some people hit "post").
fields.summary: Crucible loses comments in auto-save

fields.description:
This is the error one might see while viewing an issue's Source tab:

{noformat}
This list of changesets may be incomplete, as errors occurred retrieving changesets from the following repositories:

       Repository RRRR on http://XXXX.jira.com/source/ failed: file/revision not found: /ValidacionTama?.java@123 

{noformat}

A bug report has been filed for the FishEye Plugin:
https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/FISH-384
fields.summary: FishEye Source tab in Issue View not displaying non-latin1 filenames in changesets

fields.description: As of 2.1.1 (not 2.1) converting a user to a Developer will also add them to the "developers" group. Likewise, converting a Developer to a Collaborator will remove them from the "developers" group.
fields.summary: Documentation for new developer account behaviour

fields.description:
The "developers" group is for better out-of-the-box experience.

When a user of developer account is created, the user is added to the "developers" group (if one exists), which gives the newly created user the developer role in JIRA's permission schemes. Note that customer can customise JIRA studio by renaming this group or creating developers group per project.

However, currently, when changing a user account type from "collaborator" to "developer" does not add the user to the "developers" group even if the group exist. Conversely, when changing a user account type from "developer" to "collaborator" does not remove the user from the "developers" group. This behavior will confuse customers who haven't customise their groups.
fields.summary: When switching user account type from "developer" to "collaborator" or from "collaborator" to "developer", the user should also join/leave the "developers" group if one exists

fields.description: Upgrade GH to 4.3
fields.summary: Upgrade Greenhopper to 4.3

fields.description:
For many customers, JIRA's workflow is the first thing to be customized, and having just the default workflow conditions and post-functions is very limiting.   The Misc Workflow Extensions plugin is a fairly stable, popular set that customers have requested:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Misc+Workflow+Extensions
fields.summary: Plugin request: Misc Workflow Extensions Upgrade

fields.description:
Please read the following email thread:

> On 4/9/10 3:59AM, Michael Knighten wrote:

That's fine.


On Tuesday, March 9, 2010, Douglas Butler <dbutler@atlassian.com> wrote:
>
>
>
> Hi Michael et al.,
>
> I like the willingness to support as much as possible, but I'm not sure that's the best idea in this case.  This request (Studio + local Bamboo) is coming up more often in my experience.  In general, a definitive policy is easier for us on customer facing teams to communicate and arguably better for the customer as expectations are set appropriately.  I would propose:
>
> - Fully document the solution (there's an old doc from before Bamboo in Studio that could be updated a bit to fill this bill)
> - A detailed doc will give TST something to point people to when they want to go down this path
> - Make it Not Supported for the time being, because problems with customer installed sw + Studio + firewall considerations on their side, etc. could be a rathole
> - This will prevent situations where a customer is helped a bit, then we pull back when things get hairy, leaving them feeling stranded
>
> Thoughts?
> ..db
> 
>
>
> On 3/9/10 4:45 PM, Michael Knighten wrote:
> It is _not_ fully supported - we're happy to assist if its
> something easy, but the only _supported_ Bamboo configuration is with
> the integrated Boo.
>
> -MK
>
>
>   On Mon, Mar 8, 2010 at 1:45 PM, <roy@atlassian.com>
> wrote:
>
>
>     Are
> there any support implications that we need to know about and also to
> tell customers?
>
> Is it fully supported? As in any problem they have just raise a support
> ticket?
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Michael Knighten" <mknighten@atlassian.com>
> To: "rmk" <roy@atlassian.com>
> Cc: "Joshua Wold" <jwold@atlassian.com>,
> "Jesse Gibbs" <jgibbs@atlassian.com>,
> "Douglas Butler" <dbutler@atlassian.com>,
>     studio-team@atlassian.com
> Sent: Tuesday, 9 March, 2010 4:30:17 AM GMT +10:00 Canberra / Melbourne
> / Sydney
> Subject: Re: Jira Studio Hosted [jetstar.com]
>
> I don't have any problem with customers using Studio with their own
> Bamboo if they like. They lose the integration points, but gain their
> own remote builds etc.
>
>
>     -MK
>
>
>     On Sun, Mar 7, 2010 at 2:29 PM, rmk <roy@atlassian.com> wrote:
>
>
>       That's
> strange because when I asked Studio Support here in Sydney they said it
> was not supported.
> I spoke with Michael Knight.
>
> I know it used to be supported before we had Bamboo available in
> Studio, but now that we have Elastic Bamboo it is no longer supported.
>
> Maybe Michael Knighten should give us the official word on this.
> I have CC'd him in.
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Joshua Wold" <jwold@atlassian.com>
> To: "Jesse Gibbs" <jgibbs@atlassian.com>,
> "Douglas Butler" <dbutler@atlassian.com>,
> "rmk Krishna" <roy@atlassian.com>
> Sent: Saturday, 6 March, 2010 9:15:24 AM GMT +10:00 Canberra /
> Melbourne / Sydney
> Subject: Fwd: Jira Studio Hosted [jetstar.com]
>
> FYI - As the three of you had some opinions about this, I checked with
> David Yu in support about Studio and an on-prem Bamboo.  He said there
> are a few clients who are using it this way and support will connect it
> for a client who wants.  He's unsure if there will be any 'lost'
> functionality based upon the trusted apps linkage.
>
>
>       Thanks.
>
>
>       JW
fields.summary: Document JIRA Studio with Bamboo standalone

fields.description:
The user should be able to specify a space separated list of plan-keys that are triggered when a commit to the repository has been performed.
This list will be applies to svn hooks/post-commit to trigger a bamboo build.
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Triggering+a+Build+on+Code+Check-in
fields.summary: Allow customer to specify a list of plans to be triggered via VCS post commit hook script

fields.description:
as many other, i have set in FF the ui.key.contentAccess=4 to be able to use alt+s to activate saving in many webapps (jira and confl for instance) b/c doing shift+alt+xxx is just too cumbersome.

however, in JST this now poses the problem that the dropdown of the dashboard is bound to that too and now prevents me to activate the address bar when in JST.

PLZ fix this ASAP as keyboard access to the address bar is *very vital*.

see http://forums.mozillazine.org/viewtopic.php?t=446830
http://kb.mozillazine.org/Ui.key.contentAccess#Possible_values_and_their_effects
fields.summary: access key for Dashboard drop down  (D) interferes with address bar shortcut alt+d in firefox when ui.key.contentAccess=4

fields.description: We could potentially eliminate all requests from customers to upload their keys and certs for EBS access if our interface allowed them to upload via the browser.
fields.summary: Allow customers to directly upload keys and certificates for Bamboo

fields.description:
In normal Bamboo, a user is able to configure his account preferences, including his IM account, on this screen:

* http://studio.atlassian.com/builds/profile/userProfile.action

In studio, the user cannot edit that screen. 

Because of that, the user can never authenticate his jabber address, and therefore can never respond to any of Bamboo's chat messages.
fields.summary: User cannot configure his Bamboo Chat account, therefore the label/comment feature doesn't work

fields.description:
to reproduce:
# visit a private page when not logged in, e.g.: https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-UPM-12
# login
# get redirected to https://studio.atlassian.com/%2Fsource%2Fcru%2FCR-UPM-12 which doesn't work (404)

sounds like resolved issue AOD-1193
fields.summary: Redirection after login broken

Create a release task  list

This should include an item for upgrading bundled plugins (and maybe consider customer plugins too)

fields.description: for Confluence 3.2
fields.summary: Support Confluence Easy Reader theme

fields.description: According to Ted, this should be a full license for all Studio customers
fields.summary: Balsamiq is being deployed with an eval license

fields.description:
Customers are running into Subversion bugs/limitations that are present in the current version (1.6.5):

* http://subversion.tigris.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=3486
* http://subversion.tigris.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=3443

These are fixed in 1.6.6. Subversion is currently up to 1.6.9.
fields.summary: Upgrade to Subversion >= 1.6.6

fields.description:
After the upgrade, attempts to access applications in the Studio instance through the Eclipse Connector result in an error that looks like the following:

{noformat}
HTTP Status 400 - The value 'MYPROJ' does not exist for the field 'project'.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

type Status report

message The value 'MYPROJ' does not exist for the field 'project'.

description The request sent by the client was syntactically incorrect (The value 'MYPROJ' does not exist for the field 'project'.).


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Apache Tomcat/5.5.23
{noformat}
fields.summary: Eclipse Connector no longer works after Studio 2.1 upgrade

fields.description:
This problem prevents users from seeing commits referencing their project keys from across multiple projects.

To reproduce on test.jira.com:

1) View the [source|http://test.jira.com/browse/DPJ-1?page=com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin%3Afisheye-issuepanel] tab for DPJ-1 and note that no commits appear.
2) Note that the repositories AP, DPJ, and BINKY are associated with [DPJ|http://test.jira.com/secure/admin/EditProjectMultiLinks!default.jspa?pid=10210&app=FISHEYE].  Remove AP, and BINKY, and then re-add them back.
3) View the [source|http://test.jira.com/browse/DPJ-1?page=com.atlassian.jirafisheyeplugin%3Afisheye-issuepanel] tab for DPJ-1 again, and notice the commits now appear.
4) Restart JIRA and notice that the commits disappear again.
fields.summary: Fisheye Plugin Applinks configuration lost after restart

fields.description:
The symptom of this problem is that trying to perform any operation (in the screenshot, clicking 'delete' alongside the 'diego' group) results in an error message:

  Unable to synchronise permissions with Crucible: com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: Unexpected response received. Status code: 404.

!errorupdatingperms.png!

The change does not take effect. This occurs when we have imported Crucible data, rather than having Crucible created as a side-effect of Studio project creation.
fields.summary: Error updating Source repository permissions with non-standard Crucible project names

fields.description:
Users are getting this error when trying to create a new project: 

FishEye: Creation of FishEye repository 'XYZ' failed.

Looking closer, it looks like the Studio plugin did not start.

The plugin has to be re-enabled before projects can be created.
fields.summary: Studio plugin in Fisheye disabled during startup -- can't create new projects

fields.description:
StAC Confluence is running 1.1.x, from 2008.
Current version is [1.6.63|http://balsamiq.com/products/mockups/confluence#download]
fields.summary: Update Balsamiq to the latest version

fields.description:
- Create a project
- Create bamboo plan
- Remove build plan (In Bamboo administration)

This will also remove the project from Bamboo. Because there is no project, users are unable to create a new build plan.
fields.summary: Deleting last build plan in bamboo also deletes the project in bamboo

fields.description: After the 2.1 upgrade, many users are reporting login problems.  After entering a username and password they are redirected back to the login screen, without any errors or warnings.  Clearing the browser's cookie cache for the Studio domain fixes the problem, but this solution is not obvious to most people.
fields.summary: Users unable to log in after 2.1 Studio upgrade due to cookie problems

fields.description:
After the Studio 2.1 upgrade some instances have problems with JavaScript menus not working in Confluence. For example, clicking the 'Projects' link in the Studiobar will do nothing when it should bring down a list of projects.

Upon loading the page, the following JavaScript errors are reported:

* Error: AJS is not defined
* Error: placeFocus is not defined
fields.summary: Confluence menus do not work after Studio 2.1 upgrade

fields.description:
Hello,

Can you please update to [GreenHopper 4.3|http://www.atlassian.com/software/greenhopper/downloads/binary/jira-greenhopper-plugin-4.3.jar] within JIRA Studio. 

Thank You.
Nick
fields.summary: Update GreenHopper to 4.3

fields.description:
It's likely that some customers will not want chat functionality in their Gapps-enabled instance.

Currently there is no way to disable chat on the server-side without losing the omnibar entirely (i.e. by shutting down the chatbar VM).

While it is possible to disable it on the client-side, this is per-user and the admin may want to enforce it across the whole instance.
fields.summary: Need a way to disable chat server-side
Upgrade to Crowd connector to Crowd 1.7-studio-6

fields.description: I found some source files that mistakenly use tabs for indentation (or use a mix of tabs and spaces). These should be fixed to use four spaces consistently.
fields.summary: Convert tabs to spaces in Java source files

fields.description: Some users just like to administer Ubuntu over Fedora.
fields.summary: Provide a supported default Ubuntu Elastic Image with each upgrade

fields.description: https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/16393
fields.summary: Support documentation theme in Studio
Upgrade JIRA, Bamboo

fields.description: Since there has been lots of positive feedback on the CAC doc theme, why not use it in Studio?
fields.summary: Support CAC's Documentation theme

fields.description:
Customers would like the ability to use non-EC2 remote builds. 

Biggest issue is how we handle agent security, SSL key stores etc.
fields.summary: support for non-EC2 remote builds

fields.description:
A user which has been granted permission to administer a project is denied access to it. It gets the following error:

{noformat}
ACCESS DENIED
It seems that you have tried to perform an operation which you are not permitted to perform.
...
{noformat}


Steps I used to replicate: create a new user, and give them single user permission to browse and administer one project. Log in with that user, go to the project, and click "Administer Project". In there, click "Edit Project" and you get the error message.

I could not replicate this problem in Jira 4.0.1 standalone
fields.summary: User with project administration permission cannot edit project details

fields.description: We have several projects in JIRA with teams assigned to each. Some teams include contractors who are not allowed to see the source for projects to which they are not assigned. We would like to be able to configure repository access by project role rather than group, or some other mechanism which allows us to restrict access to members of the project associated with the repository.
fields.summary: Manage source permissions by project role

fields.description: It is my understanding that Atlassian OnDemand currently only supports the bundled SVN repository. We have no issues of having our issue tracking etc. hosted offsite and Jira Studio sounds like a good solution but we can't switch our source control software to make that work.
fields.summary: Support Perforce Repository

fields.description:
If you attach a file to a Wiki page, the URL provided in the JIRA Activity Stream doesn't contain the context path in the URL, resulting in a 404 error when you click the file link.

This can be easily reproduced:
1. Attach new file to page in Wiki
2. Click on link in Activity Stream
fields.summary: Activity stream generates Confluence attachment links without correct baseURL

fields.description: Details are at [Search Ideas]
fields.summary: Improved Search Ideas
Upgrade to Crowd 2.0
Change favicon to the logo uploaded by customers

fields.description:
On StAC, there are no quick nav results (just says timeout) and if you execute the search there is an error:

java.lang.SecurityException: JCE cannot authenticate the provider BC
	at javax.crypto.SunJCE_b.a(DashoA12275)
	at javax.crypto.KeyGenerator.getInstance(DashoA12275)
	at com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps.BouncyCastleEncryptionProvider$BCKeyFactory.generateSecretKey(BouncyCastleEncryptionProvider.java:264)
	at com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps.BouncyCastleEncryptionProvider$ValidatingSecretKeyFactory.generateSecretKey(BouncyCastleEncryptionProvider.java:288)
	at com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps.BouncyCastleEncryptionProvider.createEncryptedCertificate(BouncyCastleEncryptionProvider.java:206)
	at com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps.DefaultCurrentApplication.encode(DefaultCurrentApplication.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.sal.jira.trusted.JiraCertificateFactory.createCertificate(JiraCertificateFactory.java:14)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.auth.TrustedTokenAuthenticator.<init>(TrustedTokenAuthenticator.java:18)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.HttpClientRequest.addTrustedTokenAuthentication(HttpClientRequest.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.HttpClientRequest.addTrustedTokenAuthentication(HttpClientRequest.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.studio.core.search.RemoteSearchProvider.<init>(RemoteSearchProvider.java:39)
fields.summary: Quick search totally borked

fields.description: The history drop down says "loading" but never loads the history.
fields.summary: History is broken

fields.description: This file probably doesn't need to change much, but when it does, it would be nice to avoid the extra restart.
fields.summary: Auto-reload studio.properties when running in dev mode
Comments from emails fails with NPE
User names are double html-escaped in top left hand corner

fields.description:
It looks like the OAuth admin link in JIRA is only available to System Admin users, not normal admins. This means that customers are unable to configure external gadget containers to access data with authentication. For example, JIRA gadgets added to the Gmail sidebar can only fetch anonymously-viewable issues.

This probably applies to Bamboo gadgets, too, though I haven't tested them.
fields.summary: Allow customer admins to configure OAuth consumers

fields.description:
This happened while I was trying to address AOD-2154 (so this is in Bamboo).

The command I used resembled the following:
{noformat}$ curl -X DELETE --cookie $cookiesfile --data "application=SVN" --location http://test.jira.com/builds/plugins/servlet/applinks/instance{noformat}

Even though I specified "application=SVN", all the applinks were removed instead of just the SVN one.

It turned out I could just POST to the REST API with the new data and it would update it, so deleting was not necessary after all.
fields.summary: Deleting one applink through the REST API deletes all
